intro: Cirrhaea olivacea, commonly known as the oliveleaf cirrhaea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
